name: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal USA
mission: TO GENERATE CHARITABLE DONATIONS FOR HELPING IN THE TREATMENT OF CANCER IN THIRD WORLD COUNTRIES AND THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE SHAUKAT KHANUM MEMORIAL CANCER HOSPITAL AND RESEARCH CENTER. SPECIFIC GOALS INCLUDE (1) TO INITIATE CHARITABLE FUND RAISING ACTIVITIES, (2) TO RECRUIT PROFESSIONAL AND NON- PROFESSIONAL STAFF AND EXPENSES FOR THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE, (3) TO SUPPLY FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE PAYMENT OF MEDICINES, DIAGNOSTIC AND THERAPEUTIC EQUIPMENT FOR THE SHAUKAT KHANUM MEMORIAL CANCER HOSPITAL AND RESEARCH CENTER. (4) TO ASSIST IN THE RECRUITMENT OF ALL MEDICAL AND ANCILLARY PERSONNEL FOR THE SHAUKAT KHANUM MEMORIAL CANCER HOSPITAL AND RESEARCH CENTER.
programs: Cancer Registry and Clinical Data Management
theoryOfChange: By providing state-of-the-art treatment regardless of ability to pay and conducting regional research, the hospital aims to reduce cancer mortality and suffering in Pakistan.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.shaukatkhanum.org.pk/zakat (Source: https://www.shaukatkhanum.org.pk/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 95.0/100 score and maintains a 97.4% program expense ratio.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for distribution.
Total revenue reached $17,974,012 with fundraising efficiency at $0.02 per $1 raised and 9.8 months of working capital.
The charity provides multiple donation options and methods for supporting cancer treatment.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and high alignment with donor values, balanced by a need for more transparent third-party impact verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external data confidence regarding long-term impact metrics
Heavy geographic concentration of clinical services

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high due to the organization's clear Zakat policy and its focus on the urgent global health crisis of cancer treatment in the third world [2]. It offers diverse giving methods to accommodate donor preferences, reinforcing its strong fit for the Muslim community [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates a direct service model through its support of SKM Cancer Trust clinical and diagnostic services [3]. While it maintains a high Charity Navigator score of 95.0/100 and an impressive 97.4% program expense ratio, the impact score reflects a lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data in the available records [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. provides life-saving oncological care to underserved populations through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible financial model.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with costs of only $0.02 per $1 raised
Strong short-term liquidity with 9.8 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. is a registered non-profit dedicated to funding cancer treatment in developing nations, primarily supporting the Shaukat Khanum Memorial Cancer Hospital and Research Centre [1][3]. The organization is verified as Zakat-eligible, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations toward healthcare for the needy [2][4].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and high alignment with donor values, balanced by a need for more transparent third-party impact verification.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently operates with a <cite id="3">board size of 1</cite>, which presents significant governance and oversight risks.
While clinical data is available, the charity lacks clear <cite id="1">cost-per-beneficiary metrics</cite> to fully assess cost-effectiveness.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB assessment data is not available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains a 95.0/100 from Charity Navigator score despite governance flags.

case_against.summary: The primary concern is severe governance risk due to a <cite id="3">board size of 1</cite>, which limits independent oversight.

confidence.notes: Financial data is strong, but governance and detailed impact metrics are limited.

alignment.explanation: The charity offers high Muslim donor fit as a <cite id="2">Zakat-eligible</cite> organization providing urgent humanitarian healthcare in Pakistan.

credibility.explanation: Credibility is supported by a <cite id="1">95/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and verified clinical outcomes, though severely hampered by weak governance.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization must expand its <cite id="3">board size of 1</cite> to include multiple independent directors for proper oversight.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a direct service model with a <cite id="3">97.4% program expense ratio</cite> and strong liquidity.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so <cite id="1">cost-effectiveness can be assessed</cite> more rigorously.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Clinical registry data available

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct funding of affiliated hospital operations rather than traditional grantmaking.

rich_narrative.headline: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. provides life-saving oncological care to underserved populations through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible financial model.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill their zakat obligations by funding life-saving cancer treatments for the poor in Pakistan through a highly financially efficient vehicle.
donor_motivations: Want to support specialized medical care (oncology) in developing nations
Prioritize organizations with maximum financial efficiency (97.4% program ratio)
Seek to fulfill zakat obligations for healthcare
giving_considerations: Governance structure is currently limited to a single board member
Focus is exclusively on Pakistan rather than global relief
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require robust, independent board governance or those seeking to fund preventative health rather than acute clinical care.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization publishes annual cancer registry reports detailing patient volumes and diagnoses, but lacks rigorous third-party cost-effectiveness evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Funds are collected globally and deployed directly to specialized cancer hospitals in Pakistan to provide free or subsidized care to patients unable to afford treatment.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: In specialized healthcare, tracking clinical outcomes ensures that complex treatments are delivered safely and effectively in resource-constrained settings.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The high cost of oncological care and expanding hospital infrastructure in Pakistan requires continuous, large-scale funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="3">97.4% program expense ratio</cite> and exclusive focus on oncological care in Pakistan.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Broader general healthcare focus beyond oncology
similar_organizations.name: Indus Hospital and Health Network

similar_organizations.differentiator: Crowdfunding model for individual surgical procedures
similar_organizations.name: Transparent Hands

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="3">97.4% program expense ratio</cite>, maximizing the impact of donor contributions.
The charity operates with a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating extremely low overhead for generating revenue.
The organization has demonstrated a robust <cite id="3">26.2% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>, showing increasing donor trust and capacity.

strengths_deep_dive: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal stands out for its extraordinary financial efficiency. By maintaining a <cite id="3">97.4% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>, the organization ensures that nearly every dollar donated directly supports cancer treatment. This financial leanness is complemented by strong growth, evidenced by a <cite id="3">26.2% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>, allowing the charity to expand its support for facilities that treated <cite id="5">6894 malignant cases</cite> in 2021.
rich_narrative.summary: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. is a dedicated non-profit organization established to fund comprehensive cancer treatment for underserved populations, primarily supporting the Shaukat Khanum Memorial Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in Pakistan. Founded in <cite id="4">1994</cite>, the organization has grown to manage <cite id="3">$17,974,012 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. The charity operates with an exceptional financial model, reporting a <cite id="3">97.4% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that all available funds are directed toward its core mission of oncological care. Furthermore, it demonstrates remarkable <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization is fully <cite id="2">Zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting critical healthcare needs. Its clinical impact is substantial; for instance, in 2021, the supported facilities managed <cite id="5">6894 malignant cases diagnosed or treated</cite>. The charity has earned a <cite id="1">95/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong financial health and accountability metrics, though its governance structure presents some risks due to a <cite id="3">board size of 1</cite>.
